title: How to Find Your Mac Address on Samsung Galaxy

steps.title: Open your Galaxy’s Settings.
steps.content: Open your Galaxy’s Settings. You can do this by pulling down the notification bar at the top of the screen and tapping the gear icon. Alternatively, tap the Settings app (also a gear icon) in the app drawer.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap About phone or About device.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap About phone or About device . The name of this option varies by phone or tablet.

steps.title: Tap Status or Status information.
steps.content: Tap Status or Status information . One of these two options will appear in the menu, depending on your version.

steps.title: Scroll down and select Wi-Fi MAC address.
steps.content: Scroll down and select Wi-Fi MAC address . You should see your current Wi-Fi network's name. On earlier Android versions, you will see the MAC address listed right beneath "Wi-Fi MAC address." Look for a 12-digit address below this header.

steps.title: Select your Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Select your Wi-Fi network. This displays more information about your current connection, including the network speed, security type, and your auto reconnect preference. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap View more at the bottom.
steps.content: Tap View more at the bottom. This displays your Samsung Galaxy's 12-digit MAC address. [2] X Research source
